item.title: ‘I’m an idiot’: I’m middle aged, earn $68,000 a year and have $39,000 in credit-card debt
item.description: “I plan on keeping the accounts open to protect my credit, but I will cut and toss all the cards so I can’t use them.”

item.title: My father’s widow keeps sending me $200 checks in the mail. Why would she do this?
item.description: “I sent a ‘thank you’ card and asked what it was for, but I got no answer.”

item.title: I’m 72 and my wife is 57. We have $4.5 million in assets. Should she retire sooner — or should I go back to work?
item.description: With millions of dollars in assets, the decision comes down to lifestyle in or out of retirement.

item.title: Here’s the most unappreciated AI beneficiary right now, according to Ark Invest’s Cathie Wood
item.description: “I do believe the U.S. was at risk of losing innovation” before Trump entered the White House, Wood said.

item.title: He called the S&P 500 bottom. Now this stock trader can’t rule out a ‘flash crash.’
item.description: Theo Trade’s Jeff Bierman: “You have to be very careful how you approach this market.”
